posts.content:
Jukip Ponsar, disciple of the green dragon
 

Source : https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com/wiki ... ish_Slayer

Backstory

Jukip Ponsar is born astonishly strong for a gnome. He was a savage, wild, strong and pretty smart little gnome, in love with mother Nature and deep forests, a strange way of life for a gnome. As a young gnome, he was always singing in honor of Nature, alone in wild and dark forests, sometimes fighting wild animals to survive, with a rusty scimitar he was holding whit his two little but strong hands.
One day, as he was singing in the woods, he heard agressive voices next to him. Another gnome, with a wise and strange appearance, was attacked by rogues. As Jukip was helping the other gnome, this one shapeshifted into a huge old green dragon and melted the rogues. « The Gnome » was « Two souls », the wisest creature of the forest, a semi god, a dragon : two-souls-the-judges-wizard-25-druid-5- ... 56051.html
Both gnomes become blood brothers, and Two souls shared his draconic blood and power to Jukip. Those friends were, at the moment, the most powerful creatures of the gnomish world.
 
Explanations of the build / questions :

Idea of the build : to get a great and soon dev. crit with a two-handed weapon (to make massive damages against crit immunes) with a good crit. range and a very good dev. crit. DC after buffing / debuffing.

Don’t you loose some power for RP purpose by choosing a Gnome ?

I don’t think so, you only looses two strenght points, but you gain somme advantages. Small stature (+1 AB + 1 AC), bonus to listen, training against some creatures, and the cheese on this build : you use a scimitar as a two-handed weapon, so you get a two handed weapon with a high strenght (+50% strenght damages) with a better criticial range (18 – 20) than any normal two-handed weapon (with access to imp. crit. and keen age).

Why don’t you replace Curse Song by blind fight ? Why not to go 16 bard and 14 barbarian ?

Curse song is a core feat to this build, since you try to get the best dev. crit. DC, a 15 levels bard song is perfect since you get a debuff of 2 fort saves.
15 bard / 15 Barb is the perfect balance in this build : you are able to debuff the fort. Saves of 4 points with your curse song and your terrifying rage (barbarian level required : 15). You loose the bard 6th level of spells and the sweet level 16 song, but for the purpose of the build, it’s not necessary. And I don’t really like the 6th level spells of the bard, not the best to me.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hey man!

At first glance, the build seems quite well-conceived. Kudos! But I do see room for improvement according to my tastes.

I haven't had time to take an in-depth look at the build, looking at the way you spread your levels, you could move your Bard levels to Epics, bring 2 more Barbarian levels into pre-epic, ending at Bard 4, Barbarian 8, RDD 8 at level 20, thus gaining 1 extra BAB point. If you want to take it one step further and delay RDD 10 a bit, you could even go Barbarian 12, Bard 4, RDD 4 pre-epic, gaining yet another BAB point without changing much else. That's 2 more AB points kind of free of charge.

I'll look more into it maybe tomorrow. Right now I'm kind of busy.

Cheers!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Little snippet of nerdism for you...

I see from your link that the Gnomish Slayer is available from Rasheman, and was indeed created by a gnome artificer. In Baldur's Gate I (at least in the mods I have), Minsc reveals to Kivan that he received his Ranger training from a gnome in Rasheman who wielded such a weapon. Which leaves one to ponder...

Geekery disclaimer over.

You have a neat new take on the classic Bard/ Barbarian/ RDD formula here, Pan - well done!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This build reminds me of the Blade Juggernaut by cdaulepp, it kind of never ends with the next level always bringing something to the table. It truly is a level forty build but not in a bad way that it is unplayable before that but instead that it feels complete at that level. In terms of raw power, it is a monster. Defences are not in the same high standard but this is mainly an offensive toon, a fun character to be enjoyed & one of the rare strong shorties around. I'm commenting on your Min/Max version by the way.

One thing I wanted to mention is the ESF: Intimidate

Normally, we put this on Barbarians with a modified skill of 43(41) to make them truly effective, but in this case, your minimum Terrifying Rage DC is: 51 (42 ranks +3 Charisma +5 Bard Song +1 minimum roll) & thus is not needed in my opinion. Feel free to take one of Lingering Song/ Extend Spell/ Blind-Fight in your build in place of that. Ideally, you need all of these feats but alas one cannot have everything in a build...


Edit: Oh, I forgot! You might want to change the build's title a bit so that it includes the level split as well.
